intro: Seselinia austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian sesel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. It is typically found in moist meadows and along stream banks in temperate regions. Seselinia austriaca is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
